intro: Rhodopsis, commonly known as the "rose of the sea," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Aizoaceae. Rhodopsis species are characterized by their succulent leaves and showy, often pink or red flowers that bloom in spring. Due to their drought tolerance and unique appearance, rhodopsis plants are popular in rock gardens and xeriscaping.
